intro: Tithymalus unilateralis, commonly known as the one-sided tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species in its native range.
